title: Replication data for: Making Yourself Attractive: Pre-marital Investments and the Returns to Education in the Marriage Market
creator: Jeanne Lafortune
description:
I explore how a gender's scarcity may impact educational investments
using exogenous variation in the marriage market of second generation Americans in early twentieth century. I find that worse marriage market conditions spur higher pre-marital investments: the effect for males is significant, while, for females, it is only observed in highly endogamous groups. When faced with an exogenously larger number of males per females, males' marriages appear to be less stable and more likely to involve natives and highly educated spouses, while women are less likely to work and, for those in high endogamous groups, marry more immigrants.
